> No, they delete all programs and use a backup that contain the core programs.

There's a program called Deep Freeze that does that. It was on all the lab computers when I was in college (almost a decade ago). There was an encrypted copy of the hard drive image stored in a non-bootable partition. At boot it would wipe the primary partition and restore the image. 

Plenty of people lost a lot of work. And it was impossible to get Windows security updates. But I'll be damned... We never had a virus for more than ten seconds.
Swedish school is chill compared to other countries.
